sample.initiate:
Hello there, I am an interested viewer of this
code. I would like to talk to you.
sample.response:
Hello to you too! I am info bot! i'd be happy 
to explain this conversation system, or have
just a nice conversation.

How does the conversation system work?.initiate:
I am wondering how the conversation
system works, could you explain it to me?
How does the conversation system work?.response:
Sure thing! It works through a conversation
tree. These trees are made of nodes and 
joints. Then the tree is stored in a json file.

How do nodes work?.initiate: Thats cool! But how do nodes work?
How do nodes work?.response:
Well a node is simply an interaction between 
the two speakers. A node stores what the
"initiate" says, and what the "response" says.
It also stores the joints that connect to and 
come from the node.

The initiate is the person who started the 
conversation, In this case it's you. The 
response is the person who responds to the
initiate, in the case it's me.

inputs.I see, can you explain the rest to me?: How does the conversation system work?

I have other questions about the\nconver.initiate:
Hey thanks thats really cool. I have other 
questions though.

What are the limitations of the conversa.initiate: Are there any limitations to the system?
What are the limitations of the conversa.response:
Oh yes there are a few. However most 
of the limitations come from parts of the
system that haven't been implemented yet.

You can only have three joints come from a
node, you can't put images into the node, 
and there are no numbers in the system.

inputs.conversation loop:
How does the conversation system work?_How do nodes work?_I have other questions about the
conversation system._Is the entire conversation system complete?
How does the conversation system work?_How do nodes work?_I have other questions about the
conversation system._Is the entire conversation system complete?_I am totally screaming.

Is the entire conversation system comple.initiate:
Is the entire conversation system complete?
It doesn't seem like it.
Is the entire conversation system comple.response:
No the system is not complete. Firstly the 
text, and ui is not finished it uses placeholder
sprites. 

There are no pages, these pages will split the
initiate and responses text into chunks that
will show one after the other. Currently it 
just spills over. There are also no text effects
like shaking which will come later.
There are also no characters in the box to the
side of the ui which will show who is talking.
Finally the largest issue still to be fixed are 
the missing conditionals and action API.

how do joints work?.initiate:
Interesting, But now I'm wondering what
joints do.
how do joints work?.response:
Well thats easy! Joints are the simplest piece
of a tree. They are simply directional "joints"
between two nodes. They also have an 
"expression" which is simply what the joint
shows. When talking each button you see
is a joint and the text is the joint "expression"

conversation system.

What is a json file?.initiate: What is a json file? what does it do?
What is a json file?.response:
Well a json file unsurpisingly is a data storage
system. json stands for JavaScript Object
Notation. In a json file you can store data in
dictionaries and lists. It works well in python
as you can parse a dict or list and it will store
it in an easily human readable format, and 
when loading it back into python it is easy to
use.
